issue.title: [ENH] test framework: `pytest` base class for module tests

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
See here for overview of recent test framework related PRs:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053

---

This experimental PR continues carrying out the test refactor, and turns `test_all_estimators` into multiple test classes.

The expected benefits are:
* easy use of tests in sister packages, extension packages, packages adopting the `sktime`interface, or custom local use cases
* "run tests" one-method call to run all tests for one estimator

In this PR, the pre-PR logic in `test_all_estimators` is moved into two classes:
* `BaseFixtureGenerator`, which takes responsibility for fixture generation
* `TestAllEstimators`, which contains all the tests, and inherits from `BaseFixtureGenerator`

`pytest` automatically discovers the tests in `TestAllEstimators` with fixtures coming from `BaseFixtureGenerator`, so there should be zero change to the test logic. This part is only a structural refactor.

`BaseFixtureGenerator` is designed to provide extension by inheritance, i.e., it is meant to be customized by inheritance overrides, such as for use in module tests in `sktime`, or external packages.

This PR also adds another class, `QuickTester`, which is a mixin that adds the method `run_tests`. This can be invoked on any estimator or estimator instance, and will run all tests in `TestAllEstimators` only for that estimator. In the future, this can be used in any other test class we may write in the future based on the same design.

Minor changes:
* `create_conditional_fixtures_and_names` will ignore fixture variables for which no generators exist (i.e., no keys in the generator dict), instead of erroring out
* fixes bug in `get_fixtures` on return handling in rare case where precisely to fixtures are returned and no names. In this case, the list would be split, instead of adding names, because only `len` and not the type was checked.

issue.title: [ENH] test framework: test class for forecasting module

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
See here for overview of recent test framework related PRs:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053

---

This PR refactors the `test_all_forecasters` module to the new test class based design in #1987.
This PR requires and is conditional on #1987, all changes to `test_all_estimators` should be reviewed in #1987.

Besides the refactor, the conditional fixture generation plug-in is used to remove the dozen times repeated boilerplate code to obtain the `n_columns` variable, this is now a conditional fixture instead.

No further refactoring is carried out, although there would be some opportunity based on this (e.g., using scenarios or moving to `test_all_estimators`). Ideas for further refactoring along natural lines are left in the code as todo comments.

issue.title: [ENH] test framework: test classes, generators for fixture lists, pytest-xdist enabled

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
See here for overview of recent test framework related PRs:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053

This seems to be the fastest combination of conditions, and one where the tests pass!

---

Version of #1992 with generators rather than lists being returned by the `generator_dict`, and `pytest-xdist` added back.
Equivalently, a version of #2022 with `pytest-xdist` added back.

This is to diagnose whether #2022 - which seems to have solved a major memory bottleneck - will now work with `pytest-xdist` 
That is, except for the known bug with `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` #1941; a skip for the test is also introduced in this PR.

issue.title: [ENH] test framework: caching fitted estimators

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
See here for overview of recent test framework related PRs:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053

---

Experimental version of #1992 with:
* generators for pytest fixture combinations
* hash-caching of fitted estimators to avoid compute spend on fitting an estimator/scenario combination more than once

Equivalently, version of #2022 with hash-caching.

Includes #2027 to avoid crash due to `clone`

issue.body:
See here for overview of recent test framework related PRs:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053

---

This PR contains the union of changes that seems to make testing faster:
* generators for pytest fixture combinations, from #2022
* hash-caching of fitted estimators, from #2024
* `pytest-xdist` usage with 2 workers

Also contains:
* bugfix #2027 to avoid crash with #2024 via `clone`

Removes from tests:
* `MultiRocket`, seems to cause memory crash on linux 3.8

issue.title: [ENH] test framework: `check_estimator` test, plus rename `tests` to `_tests`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
See here for overview of recent test framework related PRs:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053

---

This PR is #2055, with the one difference that the `tests` folder is renamed to `_tests`.

This ensures that the "long duration" tests on estimators are executed first and get picked up by `pytest-xdist` workers, preventing the behaviour observed that a single worker works through all the long tests and the other one is idle.

There does not seem to be an easy way to ensure that using parameters or otherwise (that I know), e.g., via the `--dist` parameter.

issue.title: [ENH] test framework: invert test loop order - estimators first, then tests

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
See here for overview of recent test framework related PRs:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053

---

This PR inverts the current loop order in the test framework.

Post-PR, the order is *first* loop over estimators, *then* loop over test modules, *then* loop over individual tests.

Pre-PR, the order was *first* loop over test modules, *then* loop over indivdual tests, *then* loop over estimators.

The post-PR order is somewhat similar to the original loop order of @mloning's framework, which was:
*first* loop over test modules, *then* loop over estimators, *then* loop over individual tests.

Implementation-wise:
* there is now just a single "big test" per estimator, `test_estimators_all_tests` in `test_all_estimators`.
* this uses the `check_estimator` utility from PR #1993 to loop over all estimator tests for an individual estimator
* which in turn uses the framework refactor to test classes in PR #1992 and #1987

Hopefully, this will reduce memory usage, since tests are chunked by estimators, and estimator related artefacts persist only for the duration of that chunk, as opposed to throughout the testing.

issue.title: [ENH] test framework: using pytest-xdist with 2 workers

repository.name: sktime

issue.body:
This PR adds test parallelization via `pytest-xdist`, with two workers.

See https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053 for further experimentation with the test framework.

issue.title: [ENH] test framework: test classes (general & forecasters) plus pytest xdist

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This is the consolidated end state of the test framework maintenance over multiple PR in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053.

This PR makes the following changes:
* it begins to move tests to classes, so they can be reused easily, e.g., in other packages
* it reintroduces `pytest-xdist` with 2 workers to speed up the tests

Test classes are introduced in the following modules:
* test_all_estimators`, this is a simple move from loose functions to class structure. This is a 1:1 replicate of https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1987
* refactor `test_all_forecasters` along the lines of this architecture, from https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1992

This PR also makes minor changes to the conditional fixtures plugin: 
* producing more readable test names
* fixing a bug that could occur if the fixture list was length two (it would be confused with a tuple return, since only length and not type was checked)
* added comments throughout the fixture parameter tuple construction that clarify what is happening

For reviewers: the diffs in `test_all_estimators` and `test_all_forecasters` look intimidating, but are mostly caused by added indentation - as functions move to the classes, a single indentation is added to most code, and a "self" argument is added to the function signature. Some fixtures are moved to the generator functions.
